First scroll, first scroll Jia Rui Jia Xia Fan, Shi Zhuai Fan, Er Pi says Jia is good, and also beautiful. Cang Jie's Chapters say Rui is auspicious, and also responsive. It means if there is the virtue of goodness and beauty, then it will respond to this auspiciousness.

Tang jiao gu mao fan Tang means empty, empty means chaotic. The Shuowen Dictionary says jiao means to disturb, pronounced hu dao fan. Nao means to agitate. The Shuowen Dictionary says jiao means to disturb.
Dacaka, pronounced du da fan, is the name of a dragon.
Kou ji. The Shuowen Dictionary says it is written as ğ¢¼’, pronounced ku hou fan. Kou also means to strike.
Nu rui. Nu is pronounced nu ka fan. Rui is pronounced er yan fan. The Cangjie Chapter says nu means weak. The Guangya says rui means soft.
Cheng quan. Quan is pronounced qi yuan fan. The Guangya says cheng means a weight, called quan. Quan means heavy, knowing the weight. The character comes from the hand.
Second fascicle, second fascicle. Tiao ran. Tiao is pronounced tu diao fan. Pi means far. Tiao means to go. The character comes from the foot.
Gautama. This means ox.

stÅ«pa (Skt. caitya) means a shrine or tomb, or it refers to a high monument made of stone and other materials as a memorial. The old term stÅ«pa or caitya are all light and heavy in pronunciation in Chinese.

- Volume 3 - Volume 6 Volume 6 Hu Duiå, Er Ya says that fog is called hui, meaning that when it is foggy, heaven and earth merge, and nothing can be seen. When the fog is heavy, it is dark even during the day.

Kuang Qing is pronounced Kuang Guoå. Er Ya says that kuang means large.
Ban is also written as ç­, with the same pronunciation of Bo Ganå. Xiao Pi says that ban means to spread out, and Er Ya says that ban means to distribute evenly.

7 Volume 7, Volume 7. Dan Ping, pronounced tu qianå, Chi Yiå. Guang Pi says Dan Ping means a kind of board game. Han Shu Yin Yi says Ping means useless. It also means distant. Ping means to stretch the fingers. Pung is pronounced Pu Gengå.
Huanyan, pronounced Hu Zhanå. Guang Pi says Huanyan means confused and disordered. Yao means to illuminate.

Guai, pronounced Wu Bianå, Yin, pronounced Yu Jinå. Guang Pi says Guai means dull. Cang Jie Pian says Yin means evil. Zuo Chuan says not following the classics of virtue and righteousness in the mind is Guai, and not speaking words of loyalty and trustworthiness is Yin.

Cheng, pronounced Chou Jingå. Shuowen says Cheng means to pass through. Xiao Pi says Cheng means to be happy. Fangyan says from Guan to the east it is called Cheng, between Jiang, Huai, Chen, and Chu it is called Hao.
Cong, pronounced Yi Ruiå. Cong means to listen to subtle sounds. Rui means knowledge and understanding. It also means foresight is called Rui, and profound understanding is called Rui.
Fang Wei, pronounced Yi Huaiå. Guang Pi says Wei means a corner. Huai Nan Zi says Heaven has four Wei. This is it.

To praise and disparage (bao pian) is pronounced as bao gao fan and bei jian fan respectively. It means to exalt and belittle.
To plan and discuss (mou yi) is pronounced as mou hou fan. It means to discuss and plan matters.
To debate (di lun) is pronounced as tu fan. It means to confront and correspond. Di also means to match.

To be frightened and confused (huang luan) is pronounced as hu guang fan. Huang means the appearance of worry and fear in the mind. Guang Pi states that huang means to be frightened. Cang Jie's Compound Words states that huang means to be terrified.
Truly many (shi duo) is pronounced as shi li fan. Er Pi states that shi means shi. Shuowen defines shi as above.

In the eleventh fascicle, to bridle (tan e) is written as ã§– with the same pronunciation as wu e fan. It is used to control the necks of oxen and horses. E also means a yoke. Ge is pronounced as ge.ğŸ”½To punish (zeng fa) is pronounced as zhu ge fan. Tongsu Wen defines fa as zeng. Zeng means to blame. It also means to punish and subdue.
To be dazed and confused (meng hui) is pronounced as mo beng fan and gong nei fan respectively. San Cang defines meng as not clear and hui as confused and chaotic.
I is pronounced as qing in the Shuowen Jiezi, and the Shiji has you qing and lie si. It is analyzed that you qing means in a short while and also means not for long.
To be wary and hesitant is pronounced as ji and tan. The Guangya says ji means to be afraid and tan means to doubt and have difficulties. The Shuowen says ji means to hate and detest.
To look back and glance sideways is pronounced as gu and mian. The Shuowen defines gu as to turn and show and mian as to look obliquely.

The twelfth fascicle, the twelfth fascicle. Banner and flag is pronounced as bi and zhi. The Tongsuwen says a subtle sign is called a banner. The Siqi says a flag is a character that comes from a cloth or from wood. It means using wood as a mark to record it. This is also a common usage.
Man is pronounced as mo and nu. It is also called manusha. This means person.

Ghoul is written in ancient times as gui and liang. The same pronunciation as wang and liÇng. The Shuowen defines gui and liang as the essence of mountains and rivers. The Tongsuwen says a strange wooden or stone pillar is called a ghoul. This is why.

Volume 19, Volume 19, who is pronounced as chu liu in the reverse. Chuci says, Who can be paired with you? Wang Yi says, Two people are a pair, four people are a group. A group is a category. It is also written as a companion.

Kudu is pronounced as ku mu. It means violent and tyrannical. Shuowen says ku means urgent and severe. Baihu Tong says ku means extreme and the teachings and orders are to the extreme.
Ji chu is pronounced as ji zhi fan. Xiao Pi says ji means to look forward to.
Piao gu is pronounced as pi yao fan and gong hu fan. Piao means to blow, and gu means to move. According to the text, all moving things are called gu.
In the twenty-fifth fascicle, shi tu is pronounced as da hu fan. Tu means a group. Zhuangzi says Kong Qiu's tu. Sima Biao says tu means disciples.

Ren xiao is pronounced as ai ren fan. Loving people and extending it to things is called ren. The ruler and subjects treating each other with kindness is called ren. Valuing the wise and treating one's relatives with kindness is called ren. Sacrificing one's life for others is called ren. Er Pi says serving one's parents well is xiao. Shi Yi says loving and forgetting one's own labor is xiao. Obediently following one's parents' orders without disobedience is xiao.
Cheng bin is pronounced as bi jin fan. Bin means to receive.
26 Volume 26, second fascicle. If one wishes to be public-minded, it is pronounced as gou hou fan. Guang Pi says gou means to be cautious and sincere.

To speak is pronounced as yu qian fan and xi si fan. Straightforward speech is called yan. After speaking, it is called yu. In the Liji, it says In the mourning period of three years, one speaks but does not speak. Yan also means to express auspiciousness. Shuowen says ci means to speak externally what is in the mind. It also means to examine one's words.
Volume 27, second fascicle. To measure is pronounced as da hu fan and tu ge fan. Guang Pi says to measure is to discuss and calculate. It also means to measure and quantify.
Every time is pronounced as mo pei fan. In the San Cang, every is said to be a non-definite word. Every also means frequently.
To reproach is pronounced as cai xiao fan. To reproach means to tease, ridicule, and blame. It also means to scold.
Volume 28, second fascicle. To tie a rope is pronounced as nu zhen fan. Zilin says a single rope is called a tie. A tie is a rope.

Jian is pronounced as shi for the first character and qi for the second. Shuowen defines jian as sharp.ğŸ”½Lu is pronounced as li for the first character and zhu for the second. It is written as ğ¥‚– with the same pronunciation. It means the appearance of water flowing down.
Ulumphe is pronounced as wu for the first character. This means indigo flower. The old translation says Uphala or Uphala, which are erroneous.
Pattra is pronounced as tu for the first character. This means red lotus flower. The old translation says Padma or Padma, which are all erroneous.
Qi is pronounced as qi for the first character and jing for the second. The Book of Poetry says qi qi yi feng. The commentary says qi means cold wind. Jing means urgent.
Tun is pronounced as tun for the first character. Guangya defines tunju as gathering. Ju is pronounced as cai for the first character and ju for the second.
Jiang is pronounced as jiang for the first character and eng for the second. Zile says not decaying is called jiang and things that are hard are called eng.

Kinnalo is pronounced as nu for the first character. This means a non-human being who sings like a god. Its head is shaped like a horse's head. The old translation says kinnara or gandharva, which are all erroneous.

Torch is pronounced as ju and jin, and needle is pronounced as zhi and chen. Poisonous swelling is written as wen and jin with the same pronunciation as huo. It is called wen in Jiangnan. Shuowen says it means flesh protruding.

Throat is written as yin and is pronounced as yi with the same pronunciation as qian. It means the throat. People in the north call the neck yin.ğŸ”½Peeling is pronounced as pi, and su is written as su with the same pronunciation as zi li. To receive offerings is written as xiang and is pronounced as xu yang with the same pronunciation as yang. Shuowen says it means to enjoy offerings, meaning the spirits eat qi, and also to present offerings. Xin is pronounced as xu.
To arrive is pronounced as zhen with the same pronunciation as ce jin. Erya says zhen means to arrive.
To enjoy is written as yu in ancient times and is now written as yu with the same pronunciation as yi qu. Shuowen says it means to enjoy oneself, meaning everyone has pleasure.

79 Volume 79, Volume 79 Shaqi, pronounced qi in the sand and water, is a sandbank. Shuowen says that a sandbank in the water is called shaqi. Tan is pronounced dan in the sandbank.
Volume 80, Volume 80 Shiqi mo shi fan, chi also means she tai.
Naluosuo, pronounced xia in the female, is the name of a country. The old name is the country of Varanasi.

Puli, pronounced pu in the servant, pronounced li in the slave. Guangyi says that a servant is one who is employed. Pu is to attach. Attaching oneself to others. The Zhouli says that a man who enters into a crime is called a pu. Zheng Zhong says that a pu is a slave, a lowly one who is employed.
Qiuqing, also written as xing and zeng, pronounced the same as ying in the sound class. It says that when the rain stops, it is called qing. Qing also means clear and bright.
